question.questiontext: Which of the following is FALSE?

answer.text: Restriction enzymes cut DNA of specific species.
answer.feedback: CORRECT! Restriction enzymes can cut DNA at specific sequence of any species

answer.text: DNA fragments cut by a restriction enzyme can pair with the complementary DNA of any species.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! This statement is true

answer.text: Some restriction enzymes have more than one restriction site.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! This statement is true

answer.text: The use of restriction enzyme in bacteria is to digest DNA of invading bacterial virus.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! This statement is true

question.questiontext: Which of the following comparison between restriction enzyme EcoRV and protease Pepsin is CORRECT?

answer.text: They recognize and cut specific sequence of DNA or polypeptides.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! Pepsin cut non-specifically within polypeptide

answer.text: They are extracted from bacteria.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! Pepsin is produced in human

answer.text: They work by breaking the bonding between nucleotides or amino acids.
answer.feedback: CORRECT! Restriction enzymes work by hydrolyzing phosphodiester bond between nucleotides in DNA

answer.text: The enzymatic reactions generate amino acids or nucleotides.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! Restriction enzymes only cut DNA strand, without breaking down it into simple subunits

question.questiontext: If a bacterium contains no restriction enzyme, which of the following would you expect to happen?

answer.text: It cannot replicate its DNA.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! Restriction enzyme is not involved in DNA replication

answer.text: It cannot synthesize its own protein.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! Restriction enzyme is not involved in protein synthesis

answer.text: It will be easily infected and lysed by bacteriophages.
answer.feedback: CORRECT! The natural function of restriction enzyme in bacteria is to digest the DNA of invading bacteriophages

answer.text: All of the above.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! Please try again!

question.questiontext: Restriction enzymes cleave nucleic acids at specific site by

answer.text: breaking the hydrogen bonds between bases.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! This is for the separation of double stranded DNA

answer.text: hydrolyzing the phosphodiester bond of DNA.
answer.feedback: CORRECT!

answer.text: condensing the phosphodiester bond of DNA.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! Restriction enzymes work on the phosphodiester bond by a different reaction.

answer.text: breaking the covalent bond between the base and the sugar nucleic acid.
answer.feedback: INCORRECT! Restriction enzymes do not work on this bond.
